assylias.jbloomberg

Class HistoricalRequestBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • assylias.jbloomberg.HistoricalRequestBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RequestBuilder

    public final class HistoricalRequestBuilder
extends Object
implements RequestBuilder
    This class enables to build a historical request while ensuring argument safety. Typically, instead of passing strings arguments (and typos) as with the standard Bloomberg API, the possible options used to override the behaviour of the query have been wrapped in enums or relevant primitive types.

    All methods, including the constructors, throw NullPointerException when null arguments are passed in.

    Once the request has been built, the HistoricalRequestBuilder can be submitted to a BloombergSession.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HistoricalRequestBuilder.Days
      Defines what days are returned in historical requests (weekdays only, all days etc.).
      static class  HistoricalRequestBuilder.Fill
      Defines what values are returned when a field has no value on a specific date.
      static class  HistoricalRequestBuilder.Period
      Defines the period used for historical data requests (daily, weekly etc.).
      static class  HistoricalRequestBuilder.PeriodicityAdjustment
      Defines the periodicity adjustment.

      • HistoricalRequestBuilder

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder(Collection<String> tickers,
                        Collection<String> fields,
                        org.joda.time.DateTime startDate,
                        org.joda.time.DateTime endDate)
        Creates a HistoricalRequestBuilder with standard options. The Builder can be further customised with the provided methods.

        Parameters:
        tickers - a collection of tickers for which data needs to be retrieved - tickers must be valid Bloomberg symbols (for example: IBM US Equity)
        fields - a collection of Bloomberg fields to retrieve for each ticker
        startDate - the start of the date range (inclusive) for which to retrieve data
        endDate - the end of the date range (inclusive) for which to retrieve data

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null or if the collections contain null items
        IllegalArgumentException - if
        • any of the collections is empty or contains empty strings
        • the start date is strictly after the end date

    • Method Detail

      • periodicityAdjusment

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder periodicityAdjusment(HistoricalRequestBuilder.PeriodicityAdjustment periodicityAdjusment)
        Sets the period and calendar type of the output. To be used in conjunction with Period Selection.

      • period

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder period(HistoricalRequestBuilder.Period period)
        Parameters:
        period - Sets the period of the output. To be used in conjunction with Period Adjustment.

      • currency

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder currency(Currency currency)
        Parameters:
        currency - Sets the currency in which the values are returned

      • days

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder days(HistoricalRequestBuilder.Days days)
        Sets to include/exclude non trading days where no data was generated.

      • fill

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder fill(HistoricalRequestBuilder.Fill fill)
        If data is to be displayed for non trading days what is the data to be returned.

      • maxPoints

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder maxPoints(int maxPoints)
        Parameters:
        maxPoints - Sets the maximum number of data points to return.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of points is negative

      • adjustDefault

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder adjustDefault(boolean adjDefault)
        Default setting: true
        Parameters:
        adjDefault - If true, historical pricing is adjusted based on the DPDF BLOOMBERG PROFESSIONAL service function.

      • adjustAbnormalDistributions

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder adjustAbnormalDistributions(boolean adjAbnormal)
        Default setting: false
        Parameters:
        adjAbnormal - If true, historical pricing is adjusted to reflect: Special Cash, Liquidation, Capital Gains, Long-Term Capital Gains, Short-Term Capital Gains, Memorial, Return of Capital, Rights Redemption, Miscellaneous, Return Premium, Preferred Rights Redemption, Proceeds/Rights, Proceeds/Shares, Proceeds/ Warrants.

      • adjustNormalDistributions

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder adjustNormalDistributions(boolean adjNormal)
        Default setting: false
        Parameters:
        adjNormal - if true, historical pricing is adjusted to reflect: Regular Cash, Interim, 1st Interim, 2nd Interim, 3rd Interim, 4th Interim, 5th Interim, Income, Estimated, Partnership Distribution, Final, Interest on Capital, Distribution, Prorated.

      • adjustSplits

        public HistoricalRequestBuilder adjustSplits(boolean adjSplit)
        Default setting: false
        Parameters:
        adjSplit - if true, historical pricing and/or volume are adjusted to reflect: Spin-Offs, Stock Splits/Consolidations, Stock Dividend/Bonus, Rights Offerings/ Entitlement.
